Reviews.Title: “First rate”
Reviews.Author: Brahmstein
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property for a week in January and another week in February 2012. The service was consistently solid in all departments. Rooms are large and appear even more cavernous because of the high ceilings. The restaurant, Laurie Raphael, offers bold cuisine, featuring local QuÃ©bec terroir - samplings of artisinal cheeses and mushroom foie gras were memorable. A decent breakfast buffet is included in the room rate, which was around C$200 a night when I was there. There's also great sushi (Shodan) around the corner and lots of shopping within four square blocks of the hotel. Bite into a crisp Granny Smith apple which you'll find nested in little wall niches throughout the hotel, and consider the rickety elevators part of the charm of this wonderful little package in the heart of Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Odd rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the hotel for business, and avent been disappointed. All the charm of the boutiques in Old Montreal, but centrally located. A great quiet room with good space to work and relax (I get the two doubles room, as the single bed rooms I understand are quite small). One thing to note is the shower/bath has a large glass wall that goes into the living area (there are blinds, but be aware... Could be fun, or inappropriate depending on who is staying with you)... A great little bar and excellent breakfast can also be found a the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First true boutique hotel in Montreal and still wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Phil B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here whenever we come up to Montreal for a winter holiday. The entire vibe is well thought out - they've almost made it an art form.

Reviews.Title: “Chic perfection”
Reviews.Author: Blackjack4949
Reviews.Content: This place is a fabulous little gem in Montreal. The rooms are chic and perfectly minimalistic. I love the detail of the full glass wall in our bathroom that made the room seem much more ample. The staff here was so pleasant and helpful. The front desk helped us pick the best night spots and shopping spots. The location is really close to all the restaurants and bars. In fact when i asked for a cab one of the hotel valets was not busy and drove me to the restaurant with a hotel vehicle! The breakfast here was also delicious. I have stayed both here and at the W and found my stay here much more pleasant. While both are on par status wise i found Le Germain more appealing and relaxed. Of course the W offers more of an exterior wow factor and a trendy bar on site. But overall my experience at Le Germain more pleasant. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler75
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights at Le Germain. The hotel is a converted office building and they have done a good job in making the most of the building's bones. Rooms are large with nice windows and high ceilings. Decor is "chic boutique," in other words minimalist.. Bed was very comfortable. Room service and restaurant offerings in the hotel are just serviceable - don't expect spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, comfortable and relaxed style”
Reviews.Author: tsgbhalf
Reviews.Content: Just a sample of one night, but this was a great service experience from start to finish. The hotel staff are engaged in making this place work for you. Facilities top notch as well.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist chic”
Reviews.Author: CakeNine
Reviews.Content: I love the Germain Group hotels and agree with the previous reviewer that too try to stay in them when I'm in Canada. This hotel has less charm than the Germain in Quebec City but just as much minimalist chic. Very attentive staff, fabulous coffee service in the lobby (wish there was the option of china cups instead of just disposable), super-comfortable bedding, gorgeous bathrooms. The glass-walled shower means you need to be prepared to be a bit of an exhibitionist but that's part of the fun of the hotel. Hotel breakfast in Laurie Raphael is delicious and relaxed although the getting any table service for coffee etc. was difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot in MTL - but not ideal for business”
Reviews.Author: rovingfamilyman
Reviews.Content: Le Germain has very good service (front desk in particular), with comfy beds and great design. Rooms have nice little touches, good quality furnishings and nice flat screen tvs. As with many boutiques, I do find that you sacrifice a bit on some of the things I come to rely on as a business traveler. I often have to work in the roomand find that the workspace, while efficiently designed is small. Le Germain's restaurant (androom service) closes at 10:30, which can be too early if working late. I've found myself having to wolf down $10 bags of cashews late at night when I would have loved a good meal. Also, no in-house dry cleaning which is inconvenient if forced to stay an extra night and you need a clean shirt. All in all, though, these are relatively small complaints. Le Germain gets it right on the important stuff (location, service and comfort). Not only would I recommend it but I am heading back this week!

Reviews.Title: “You feel like a hipster, even if you're a nerd”
Reviews.Author: cynthiarmstrong
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest boutique chain! I wish they were in the U.S. too. I stay here whenever I'm in Canada even though they don't have a points program. The staff is amazing - they are all Ã¼ber hip but ALL so nice, friendly and helpful - it's like the cool kids in high school welcomed u to their clique. The rooms are unique and decorated in a sort of loft/quasi-industrial style. The bathrooms are huge and have all different types of special design features. Great amenities and free wifi. Oh, and free continental breakfast. I love this hotel so much I want to marry it!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, welcoming, walking distance to shopping”
Reviews.Author: Andree59
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Montreal to visit our son who is studying at Concordia. We wanted a nice hotel within walking distance to his residence and shopping. Le Germain was perfect. Dropped the car off at the door when we arrived, no worries about parking or driving in the city. Very spacious room, big tub for soaking and relaxing. The buffet style gourmet breakfast was delicious, with excellent capuccino!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hÃ´tel with large rooms but not much warmth”
Reviews.Author: lesmad
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le Germain last week for several nights. The rooms are large but not very warm, comfortable or cozy. The look is industrial chic, but painting concrete brown is a strange choice. The king bed is big but not particularly comfortable. The bathroom nice and worth the room upgrade. Warning, be careful not to order room service. I paid $20 for a cheese plate with 6 little (I mean bit sized) pieces of cheese. The one plus is the breakfast which is nice, but although the staff is pleasant, they are not very efficient. I waited 5 minutes for a butter knife, my toast was, well cold toast before I could butter it, after I asked-as there were none out. And little things like having no cake soap to start and then on the third day to finally have one left by the maid was just confusing. I had assumed they expected us to use the liquid shower gel.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cdelucia
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this hotel... location was very convenient, and the hotel itself has a sort of boutique feel that made it very comfortable and unique. Rooms are very clean, luxurious and comfortable, and I found the service to be very good. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Doc92
Reviews.Content: This smaller boutique hotel at the corner of Mansfield and President Kennedy in downtown Montreal is ideally situated for walking, galleries, museums and sports. The staff are friendly, courteous and knowledgable and will gladly make reservations for almost anything. The rooms were clean comfortable and well appointed. The included buffet breakfast was identical every day but there was enough choice to satisfy most appetites. The restaurant (Laurie Raphael) provided a superb evening dining experience and should not be missed at least on night. the combination of location, staff and ambience make this Monteal hotel a "keeper".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TorCan_IK
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms and great staff made our 4 night stay really comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to the beautiful McGill Campus and to the major shopping area and a short cab ride (or long walk) can get you Old Montreal. The breakfast buffet is nothing to write home about, but it is better than nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Le Germain”
Reviews.Author: jensamsmom
Reviews.Content: We had a great overall stay at Le Germain. Check-in was quick and courteous. The room, though small like most urban hotel rooms, was well appointed, clean, and comfortable. Though we arrived during the week, street noise was minimal (keep in mind that we stayed on the 16th floor). The bed was also notably comfortable. We only ate breakfast at the hotel (the included buffet) so I can't really comment on the restaurant. Breakfast was fine, nothing out of the ordinary but certainly more than adequate. Location was good, near McGill and within walking distance to the Museum of Art and right at a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, bad wifi”
Reviews.Author: Car_guy3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, helpful staff. I did not sleep at this hotel but met with a client who was staying at the hotel. I spent some time in the lobby (which is beautiful) waiting for my customer and while there I decided to use the Internet. Surprisingly for a downtown hotel there is no password and anyone (including people in the street) can use the internet. In my case it was very slow and I could see several other computers in my "Network Neighborhood" which indicates that they are not at all focused on security. My client mentionned that the internet was very slow during the previous evening to the point of resembling dial-up.

Reviews.Title: “Great smaller hotel in the downtown/McGill area”
Reviews.Author: pingle
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference in Montreal and this was a good choice. We both like smaller comfortable hotels with character, and this fit the bill. I enjoyed the chocolate croissants at breakfast, but don't forget to try the Montreal Mile-End bagels they have their as well (thinner than American bagels). Appreciated the easy free wi-fi, water bottles in room, and apples to snack on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel, all in all.”
Reviews.Author: TheEmergencyDoc
Reviews.Content: The location is just perfect. Within walking distance from almost every thing you need to do or see in Montreal. If you didn't want to walk, the metro station (subway) is literally next door. Very clean and quiet. Continental breakfast, Wi-Fi Internet and a nice espresso machine in the lobby are all included, such a pleasant surprise. The staff are friendly, helpful and bilingual. Not exactly cheap but worth the expensive rate of close to $300 per night (including taxes). Very comparable to the W hotels if you are familiar with that very cool chain.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: maude_leroux
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at Le Germain (Montreal) and were pleased with the wonderful service. The staff is very available and helpfull. The room was modern, elegant and clean. Very recommandable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: MGSUCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at their property in Toronto and it was a beautiful property, so we excitedly booked at this property too. Sadly, the hotel is not as nice as the one in Toronto. The rooms look poorly maintained. There is little storage space for clothing - only hanging items, no dressers for folded items. The staff at the hotel was great. We had a problem with our room and they upgraded us to a bigger room immediately. While the new room was nicer and larger, it still felt poorly maintained. The hotel is in a great central location, but it is overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: yankeesfanz
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast was included, but's its minimal. I wouldn't pay extra for it next time.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Clavoie1
Reviews.Content: They really take care of you. Excellent room appointments. Good bed. Everything is very high end. Good downtown location. Free breakfast is pretty good. Overall something special here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic hotel would certainly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SurreyHoliday1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 9th August until 11th August for business, I wish I could have stayed longer!! The hotel is in a fantastic location very near the shopping district and a 20 minute walk to the downtown area where there are amazing restaurants and shops. Montreal is a french speaking region however all the staff at the hotel spoke English. The hotel is very chic and modern and most importantly clean!! The staff was very friendly, we managed to purchase tickets to the Rogers Tennis Tournament through the concierge, who managed the booking for us. Breakfast was simple but adequate, bagels, cheese, ham, pancakes, cereal and fruit. Along with fruit juices, tea and coffee. Breakfast is served until 10:30am which makes a nice change so you can have a lay in if need be and still have breakfast. The rooms are amazing, very modern. The toiletries are all Molton Brown and the walk in shower is heaven!! There are no tea/coffee facilities in the room but there is a mini bar but it is expensive, I believe $5 for a small bottle of water. There is a docking station along with a radio which is set to the Jazz radio station which plays wonderful music. There is a safe in the room along with a hairdryer, ironing facilities and a TV. Due to being in Montreal on business I cannot comment on the local attractions but if I were to visit Montreal on holiday I would certainly stay here. Taxi's are called for you by the hotel staff and arrive minutes later. There is a gym however I cannot comment on that as I did not use/see it. There is also a restaurant in the hotel but again I cannot comment, I would suspect that it is expensive however probably worth the money. However for the sake of a 20 minute walk to downtown there are plenty of restaurants ranging from French to Italian. I had just arrived at the Le Germain hotel from the Sheraton Centre in Toronto where all I saw were large high rise tower blocks and concrete and to arrive in Montreal and see trees, parks, cobbled streets and homely restaurants I was most impressed!! Not cheap but worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not as good as Le Germain Hotel in Quebec City.”
Reviews.Author: Franciscoar
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a night in this hotel in Montreal after having stayed at Le Germain in Quebec City... and we found the hotel in Montreal rather disappointing. First, the lobby is very noisy because it connects with the restaurant on the first floor. Second, the building lacks the charm of the Quebec hotel. Third, breakfast was rather "average" if not short of food like jams. Finally, the staff made their best to be helpful but ... Something really positive, the hotel is situated downtown, close to the best area in St Catherine Street.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huggles77
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. Wonderful conceige services (ask for Patrick) .Room was generously- sized, the bathroom was HUGE, closet with compartments and cubbies. Daily complimentary breakfast with rolls (chocolate croissents-yum), fruit, bagels, yogurt, french toast and more. Located in McGill University area, close to tons of shopping, financial area/banks. Super restaurants near-by. Courtesy cars are Audi 2012s. Great valets, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: eikoleto
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Le Germain! Lovely modern hotel with fantastic staff. Highlights: - Bed is divine -- so comfortable - Really like the room layout; the blinds between bed and bathroom can be pulled, but when closed, feels very private. The toilet itself is well away from the bed and has its own door. - Breakfast is free - Staff are wonderful -- in both the lobby and the restaurant, they went out of their way to be helpful. We left a tip at breakfast and the next day, our server was even more attentive. - One evening we asked the front desk to call us a cab -- instead of doing so, one of the staff members (who was awesome) drove us to our destination in a nice car. Kept us entertained and made for a fun trip. - Staff are around at all hours, so it feels very safe coming home late - Very modern rooms with unique styling. Not huge, but great for a couple. - Excellent mini bar selection - Great location: central but not on a crazy street. Felt like a little oasis tucked away, but right in the thick of it all. Very close to the Metro station. The only downside was the breakfast. After reading reviews we really wanted to prove others wrong, hoping things had improved. We're not very picky, so we'd hoped maybe it was just foodies who'd expected more. The hotel is serving more warm items, but unfortunately they just weren't very...warm. It seems like they are trying, so hopefully they'll get it right. That being said, the coffee was excellent. Note: we would have eaten dinner in the restaurant (or ordered room service) however there's not much on the menu for vegetarians. A great stay though - we'll definitely be back and we highly recommend Le Germain!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Really.”
Reviews.Author: Montreal_love
Reviews.Content: After almost five years since my last visit, I stayed at Le Germain for two nights last week and everything was perfection. The staff is friendly without being too present, the rooms are flawless and the beds are...unbelievable. The view on President Kennedy St. is also stunning. Very urban.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Tico1979
Reviews.Content: We've been welcomed like VIP guests as soon as we arrive at the hotel. If you're looking for special attention, professionalism and luxury, go to Hotel Le Germain! The room was uniquely designed and just perfect for a business and pleasure stay. Also, the food served at Laurie Raphael surpassed by far my expectations and don't forget to try the breakfast, you'll love it! On top of it, the service was just unreal; hotel and restaurant staff have meet my expectations. Try the courtesy car, very useful (Audi A8)! :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend!”
Reviews.Author: dirt116
Reviews.Content: We were there, my husband and I last weekend and we had a wonderful time. All the people working there are very helpful and pleasant. The concierge help us find a very good restaurant downtown. The breakfast was excellent, great quality, great choice. The rooms are beautifully decorated and you cannot believe how comfortable the beds are. We slept like babies. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: Juju054
Reviews.Content: We really liked our stay at Le Germain. The food,the service and the room were amazing.The bed was really comfortable. Nothing to else to say!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jennlbarrow21
Reviews.Content: Le Germain Toronto was lovely so we thought when travelling to Montreal we would treat ourselves. By no means is this a bad hotel, but it also does not warrent paying close to three hundred a night. The staff was friendly and helpful but the service was very slow. When asking to fix our broken bar fridge it took till our second day for someone to come and look at it. When asking for a razor that I had forgotten I waited for close to two hours. The in room spa services were amazing though!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Daphnar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Germain Hotel in Montreal for a long weekend over July 4th (which coincided with Canada Day). We have a lovely time in our King Deluxe room. Huge bathroom, very large bedroom, large walk-in closet, nice sitting area complete with a computer desk and hi-speed wi fi that worked great. Flat screen tv was as big as the one we have at home. I was concerned about the glass wall to the bathroom but the shades go a good job of blocking light/the view so there was no issue with that. Room was clean but got a bit dusty over 5 days (but I must admit I have the same problem with my dark furniture at home). Husband thought the bed a bit soft but I was very comfortable and disagreed. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Downtown location was good for walking to McGill, some museums, and nightlife. Easy to take the Metro to the old part of the city. We also utilized the valet parking ($25/day but unlimited in/out) so that we could easily take our car to visit various foodie restaurants off the beaten path. Overall a lovely time. Would stay at their properties elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Llama11
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at Le Germain at the end of May and found the location very convenient for many museums, McGill University, and the metro. Our room was spacious and tastefully decorated with very comfortable beds. The bathroom was quite large and there was a separate toilet; everything was immaculately clean. The staff was polite, helpful and friendly, and we thought that the daily chocolate and weather forecast were a nice touch. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was good, especially the croissants. Dinner was excellent - very expensive, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “so-so...some good, some not so much”
Reviews.Author: notacamper39
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the room was the bed. It was very comfortable and had good pillows/duvet. Otherwise, I was underwhelmed...the room was a bit dark and rather small. If you opened a door to hang up your clothes or do some ironing, you had to walk on the bed to get back to the other part of the room. Plus the shower had terrible water pressure. Breakfast was included, but I should probably have just paid to eat elsewhere. The selection was poor and the service...Oh well...there was none. No one even pointed out where the food and coffee/tea was on the first morning. All in all a mediocre experience.

Reviews.Title: “For the money and proximity Sofitil or Crystal are much better value/experience especially morning breakfast which is awful at l”
Reviews.Author: warrentorch
Reviews.Content: The deficiencies, especially at morning breakfast (which I experienced 3x), were so numerous friends where tweeting and sharing in the joke. After staying at nearby Sofitil and enjoying it's hospitality I was a 'raving fan', telling all how great it is. The breakfasts were served, varied and could appear on a food magazine cover. The extreme opposite is the norm at le Germain. Even when I slightly cut my lip on a quarter-inch chip in my oj glass the attendant merely shrugged and walked away. One can buy breakfast anywhere. What hotels are selling is 'feeling'. The daytime restaurant staff fails. When I checked out after 3 days I paid cash (debit - $963) so I wouldn't have to re-live the experience when my credit card statement arrives. As I walked away I noticed my jaw was tense. That's that is not the experience I was hoping for. W.Torch

Reviews.Title: “Am I in some movie?”
Reviews.Author: ecj74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful, modern hotel in the heart of Montreal. Staff is wonderful, and they make you feel like a movie star, really. The breakfast was really good, lots of choice, and crapes to die for. If you want to feel pampered and totally enjoy your stay in Montreal, this is the hotel to go to. The price is a bit higher than people would usually spend on a hotel room, but it is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dghiglieri
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a top quality hotel and everything about it makes you feel special even down to the maid at the end of the day bringing you a chocolate and the weather forecast for the next day. The decor is functional, elegant and modern and the bathroom includes a "wet room" shower with plenty of room. All the mod cons are provided although I was disappointed that there was no trouser press. Not a problem as there was an iron and a foldaway irning board in the wardrobe. A very pleasant sty, lovely staff, gorgeous barstaff and an all round very plesant business experience. I will be going back on a regular basis

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not as good as could be”
Reviews.Author: regular_traveler05
Reviews.Content: I really like this chain of boutique hotels, but I was underwhelmed by the location in Montreal. The staff is exceptionally helpful, but some of the layout to the room was off. The location in Toronto is definitely a much nicer hotel in terms of design and space. That said, it's still a great hotel, and I would recommend. One last note -- we visited during Nuit Blanche, and the location of the hotel was very convenient to many of the events, which was very, very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: lh923
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Le Germaine for 2 consecutive busienss trips. The room was extremely comfortable and spacious with great beds and plush robes, and very convenient with free water, Aveda products, and free internet. The service in every aspect was top notch. The food was excellent, whether dinner in the restaurant or room service, or breakfast which was included in the price. The free coffee or hot chocolate in the lobby was a very nice touch. I look forward to my next trip to Montreal and Le Germaine.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with a very comfortable bed and plenty of room..”
Reviews.Author: DZuki111
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Any time i've stayed in a Germain chain, i've yet to be disappointed. Loved the little macintosh apple themes throughout the hallways and lobby. Very cute. The room was very large with a desk, king size bed, wonderfully large closet and a very nice view of the city. Interesting (they of course assume with a king room you're either travelling alone or with a person you've already seen naked) window into the shower beside the bed. Kinda cool. I loved that the room had its own personalized bathroom glasses with the room number on them. Nice touch. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was nice but not cheap for what it was. Tasty crepes though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Expensive restaurant & bar”
Reviews.Author: onemoreflight
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times now since it is in a great location for my business requirements. Love the doormen- so helpful and will drive you around downtown in the hotel car if they are not too busy. Rooms are fine, nothing truly special though. The gym is fine. Small but clean and well equipped. Downside to this hotel for me is the restaurant and bar. Food and drinks are expensive. Wait staff are not the best and for a boutique hotel at this price, they could do better. My other issue is no coffee making facilities in the room. There is a cappucino machine in the lobby but not the same as the convenience of being able to look after yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: KJC2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times while on business. The reception upon arrival is very friendly and the room ambiance with soft jazz music playing is very comforting. It's a "boutique" style hotel so the rooms are small but well appointed and cozy. As mentionned in several other reviews - the whole shower window looking into the room is interesting. Great while travelling alone as I'm able to watch TV while showering!! Overall I very much enjoy the hotel. The complimentary breakfast is nothing special but provides all the basics one need to start their day. I tried dinner in the restaurant for the first time this trip and was somewhat disappointed. Turns out the food was quite good but at first glance of the menu I couldn't find anything that sounded appealing. Worked out fine in the end and was very tasty but also very $$$$. Absolutely I would stay here again but may pass on dinner. Oh, and don't forget the FREE WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Christopher C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Le Germain on the advice of a friend. Boy, do I owe him a favour now! The hotel is great from reception, to rooms and restaurants, to the gift shop and waiting area. We had a car and they took care of the parking the car and bringing it back when we needed it. The room is well appointed with a very comfortable bed, a great desk to work at, internet, and a delightful bathroom with a glass partition between the shower and the bedroom. Great for romance! The breakfast is wonderful and has a good variety of breads and other breakfast fare. Healthy without being in your face health food. I found the staff there to be attentive and respective of privacy. The front desk staff was very good, efficient and friendly. Altogether a wonderful experience! I have tried to stay there once after this visit, but they were booked up, and we are going there again this upcoming week. I can hardly wait

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: First, there's nothing really "wrong" with this hotel, but there's also nothing spectacular. It felt like a beautifully wrapped present that holds a plain, beige sweater inside. The rooms at first look striking but upon closer inspection, things are starting to fray at the edges. Carpeting lifting up, chipped bed frame but all of that is OK, there are bigger issues. Starting at the beginning. Front desk staff - fabulous. Could not be nicer or more efficient. Now going up to the room in the claustraphobic 1-2 person elevator was nothing short of frightening. OK, maybe that was because there was a wicked lightening storm outside at the time and I had visions of being stuck in that tiny cubicle for hours. But even the bellman said that he just focuses on his breathing when he's in the elevator because it's so small and cramped. The room, with one queen bed is tiny. There's no other way to describe it. And the layout makes it feel even smaller. I had to move to a King room. Better...but still a strange layout. The toilet is in a closet. Yes. A closet, Complete with two louvred doors tha almost t hit your knees as you sit. And I'm not a big person. The shower is huge and has a full floor to ceiling glass wall that looks into the bedroom. Interesting. What's even more interesting is that there are blinds on the glass wall, for privacy one would assume, except that the blinds can only be operated from inside the bedroom area and not from inside the shower. Peek-a-boo! I cannot understand the logic here. Maybe someone can explain it to me. Food is limited and highly organic. That's fine. No complaints excepted for the very limited nature of the selections. Location is OK. My office was directly across the street so it was good for me. For anyone looking to do something after 5pm, the area is a ghost town. I walked over to St. Catherine's street, a few block away, and it was very lively but walking back, even at 9:00 was frightening as the streets were completely deserted. I don't think I'd stay here again. I can't fault the hotel on cleanliness or service, it is was it is and it's all just a little too "strange" and isolated for me.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Front Desk & Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicolefromtoronto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a converted office tower, so it's not the most interesting building in terms of architecture and the street (Mansfield) is somewhat dreary so if you're interested in a more romantic or pretty setting I would suggest the Hotel Gault which has it all - and a killer location. The Germain lobby is lovely, sleek and boutique-y but laid back. We were immediately greeted by the concierge who helped move our bags from the car inside while the valet chap was occupied. Service at the front desk is polished and professional but never perfunctory. The room was much bigger than I'd expected (room 505). An unfortunate view from the back of the hotel looking directly into an adjoining office building (I could literally see the photo on someone's desk!) and dumpsters. However, it's wall to wall windows and the sheers do a fine job of blocking out the lousy view. The bed was super comfortable; down-filled pillows; nice details like a light on in the room and jazz playing when we entered. Aveda products in the bathroom (which was also over-sized) and a separate WC - always appreciated. I'm not sure that the sound-proofing is so great as I was disturbed around 3:00 am by someone climbing stairs (the stairwell is adjacent to this particular room) and again at 5:00 by a prolonged and noisy delivery on the street - I believe the dumpsters were being swapped out. The included breakfast was superb - and a real surpise. Lovely food, nice presentation, efficient staff. Served in the pretty dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool, even for older visitors!”
Reviews.Author: hubler
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed and situated with excellent amenities, this hotel is perfect for a holiday or business. The staff are considerate and charming with one exception (see below) and everything about the place smiles! The room is comfortable and interestingly furnished with modern furniture and excellent , luxurious bedding, and even the bathroom is fun with its glass walls and subtle lights. We could live without the HUGE distorted TV and use better lighting for reading istead. The one significant proviso is breakfast, which is sloppily conducted--inadequate plates, lack of hot coffee until it was specifically requested--, and the staff person was amazingly sullen, especially when compared to everyone else. A shame to leave a bad taste in one's mouth this way. (Where is his supersvisor?)

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in a great location for visiting Montreal”
Reviews.Author: rh321
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and well furnished. Bed and bedding are supremely comfortable. While free water may not seem like a big deal, it's so nice not to have to worry about being overcharged for a bottle of water if you wake up thirsty in the middle of the night. The coffee available in the lobby 24x7 is also a nice touch. The breakfast included with your stay wonderful! You can fill up enough to skip lunch, if desired. This hotel was my third choice because my first two choices were booked. If I return to Montreal, Hotel Le Germain will be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience with some downsides.”
Reviews.Author: mendiratta
Reviews.Content: Minuses - The person manning the breakfast section is a over zealous police man, who is always suspicious of who is coming to the breakfast to eat. Couple of time , 3 of us were asked twice by the assistant and the manager at the breakfast restaurant. We all felt very embarassing. Why would someone come to the breakfast area if he or she is not staying at the hotel. Otherwise a flawless experience. Due to this incident which happened on 3 days in a row, I dock 1 star from my review. There is a subtle way of noting who comes and eat at different hours. Nobody comes twice to hog. I stayed at Le Germain Dominion for 3 days and the breakfast staff was just awesome. Le Germain Montreal need to take a leaf out of their book. - The breakfast fare doesnt change day to day, but in all still very good. - Onsite parking not included which is steep - should be included in the room rate. - Free wireless internet was slow and is more like a dialup experience Pluses - Extremely helpful staff at the lobby - 24 hour espresso machine in the lobby is a wonderful treat and it was comfortable to sit and sip after an entire day of walking. - The breakfast is elaborate with: croissant, juice, yogurt, few cheese, breads, bagels cereal, fresh fruits, granola,cakes (lemon, raspberry and banana) coffee/tea. - Conevenient downtown location - close to metro and old montreal - Matelas Dauphin beds are very comfy and after a hard day of walking and exploring, the comfy bed were a welcome relief. In all a very lovely experience

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - but be sure to check room location”
Reviews.Author: 8travelbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were there 3 nights this past week, while attending a business meeting. The hotel is stylish, trendy, handsome; staff are responsive and well-trained. We just got a terrible room - our mistake was not trying to move immediately. Our room (#705) was large and should have been comfortable. But the large windows overlooked an air shaft, with trash on a large ledge. We had little natural light, and the room was dark (dark carpet, dark brown ceiling, dark brown Venetian blinds), with completely inadequate lighting. We were constantly misplacing things, in part because we didn't have enough light. The bathroom was cavernous, at least 14-15 feet long, with a toilet at one end, and way at the other end a sink and tub/shower. We first thought it was perhaps large because it was designed as a handicap room -- but the tub/shower would not be accessible for someone with physical challenges. There was little counter space for toiletries -- and again, the bath was seriously underlit. Finally, the windows wouldn't open; we had to have the air conditioning running night and day, even when not needed. We would recommend this hotel -- but just make sure that you get a good room!

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing and Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: gallafi
Reviews.Content: There is a lovely vib to this hotel that is perfectly complemented by the city itself. We had a fabulous stay -the staff could not have been more helpful. The room was perfect and the bathroom was great as well. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, and we actually suggest you visit Montreal especially to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: columbiakat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at the Le Germain. It was the perfect hotel for our quick trip. I booked directly with the hotel which I found to be fairly easy though not without some issues. After receiving a quick response on availability, I found that actually confirming proved to be more of a hassle over email so confirmed over the phone. We found the hotel easily and valet parked our car. Parking is $25 at the hotel and you can take your car in and out as many times a day as you need to. Check-in was easy and we were shown to our room by a very helpful hotel employee. The room wasn't huge but had plenty of room for the two of us (queen size bed, two reading chairs, desk along one wall w/ desk chair, lots of closets). Style of the room was modern but not cold. Our room was exceptionally clean! There is also a room safe, iron/ironing board, Tivoli Audio Player w/ iPod dock, large LG flatscreen television. Our bathroom had a shower only but it was a large shower with a rainfall showerhead. Yes, it did have a window into the room but I found it let in a lot of natural light into the bathroom. And if it bothers you, there are blinds you can use. Water pressure could have been better but it was serviceable. Bathroom amenities were from Aveda. Two robes and a hair dryer were also provided. Breakfast was included in our room rate. The coffee definitely needs help but the breakfast had everything we needed and the service was attentive. Options included croissants, bagels, toast, yogurts, granola, crepes, baked eggs with vegetables, hardboiled eggs, ham and different cheeses. I had read in a Lonely Planet guidebook that the breakfast was subpar but I really did not feel that way at all. Now if they improve the coffee (both temperature and flavor) then it really will be fantastic. And last but not least: the hotel staff was great. Everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant. They're not overly in your face but ready to assist if you need it. If you need a place to stay in Montreal, I would highly recommend Le Germain. It's a terrific alternative to a large anonymous chain experience.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, perfect every time!”
Reviews.Author: abbeystein
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at most of the Family Germain properties (Toronto, Montreal, Quebec City) many, many times (over 55 nights at the Toronto property) and have never, ever been disappointed. As with most people who love to travel we've experienced hotel living on may levels. Some were nightmares, some were terrible, some were mediocre and some were pleasant. Seldom have we been where everything was wonderful like Le Germain. These hotels combine the luxury of other fine inns with European sensibility. The staff is well trained. This is possibly the most important element in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, except for the back-alley noise”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Montreal for business meetings and have stayed at several boutique hotels over the years. I was very impressed with Le Germain. The location is great: the train station is only a couple of blocks away. The front-desk check-in was very fast and friendly. The rooms are spacious and modern. My only problem was that all of the lights are turned on when you enter the room, and when I went to bed I couldn't figure out how to turn off the mirror light in the bathroom (the switch is rather hidden). A buffet breakfast is included and it had a nice selection of hot and cold choices. My only complaint with my visit was that my room on the 4th floor overlooked the back alley, and I was constantly awakened by delivery/garbage trucks during the night. So, I recommend you get a room that fronts onto Mansfield. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unique High Quality Experience !”
Reviews.Author: AKER_NB
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of a long weekend in Montreal last February. What was the best part of this stay? Dinner at the "Q", Celine live at the Bell Centre, a few calories at Pied de Cochon, or perhaps Le Germain. I would have to tell you the entire weekend was exactly what makes Montreal such a unique and wonderful place to visit. A large King Deluxe room nicely appointed and spotlessly clean. A warm welcome at check in set the tone for the entire stay. We had friends join us from Ottawa who were similarly impressed. Watching the City come to life each morning while enjoying an exceptional continental breakfast gives your day a perfect beginning. The location is great for shopping and exploring the city with or without a car. Sunday afternoon we explored the Old Port area and returned late to the Hotel. Having a dinner reservation in less than an hour I asked one of the Valet staff how long it would take to get a taxi. He enquired where we wanted to go and suggested the Hotel's courtesy vehicle was out on an errand and might be back in time to give us a complimentary drive. In the event this wasn't possible he would have a taxi standing by in 20 minutes. We met our friends in the lobby 15 minutes later and to our surprise the staff gave us a lift to Au Pied de Cochon. Our Chauffer was interesting to talk to and suggested the meal would be something to remember. Montreal it could be said has no shortage of things to celebrate or ways to celebrate them but a meal like this followed by Celine live in concert made for a memorable evening. The Hotel competes in a City where the people know what "service" is and where the options are many. The staff without exception are well trained, friendly and positive. Le Germain would look good on a Resume I would think in the Hospitality Business. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel to discover Montreal”
Reviews.Author: LinusMtl
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night at the Germain after winning a local contest, so we got to be tourists in our own city. This hotel is trendy, beautiful, amazingly located. Staff are welcoming and helpful, with smile at the ready. Food is provided by Laurie Raphael, one of the very good restaurants in the city with edgy local cuisine (I had their tasting menu a year ago, which was mind-blowing). This time, we had room service, which included some of the dishes of LR but not their foie gras poutine, so my husband, hum, pouted :). Rooms are beautiful. Actually, the only thing I regretted was the lack of free international TV channels. If I were here for a long stay, I might also enjoy a pool-spa but this is a boutique hotel, which generally don't provide these types of amenities anyways. All in all, a strong recommend.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosefam
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Le Germain in Montreal for a weekend getaway. From arrival to departure, this hotel is top rate. The location is excellent, near great shopping ,museums and galleries. The rooms are refreshingly upscale, modern, clean and spacious. The service is excellent and the staff from doormen to cleaning staff made us feel welcome and appreciated as guests. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: YeahMaMa
Reviews.Content: stay there for the long weekend from 09/05-09/07. unbeatable location. walking distance to all main areas and subway station. quiet area. nice front desk staffs, very professional. nice contemporary design. use real green apple as decoration at the elevator area (i saw someone actually ate the apple while waiting for the elevator). breakfast & valet parking is included in my package. end up we did not need to drive at all, everything is walking distance. breakfast is on the 2nd floor restaurant, not too many selection, but food is fancy and taste good. we got to try out a rare kind of French cheese (unbelievably good!!) *** there is a line up for the breakfast buffet though :( short on staff to clean up the table *** otherwise, everything exceeds my expectation. I normally stays at the W or the QE Fairmont; just want to try something new this time and I made a wise choice. will visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinse16
Reviews.Content: We'd like to thank everyone at the Le Germain Montreal for a wonderful stay. This is a marvelous hotel and all the staff including David, who checked us in, Kevin, who took our bags up to our room and Anik, the concierge who seemed to know all the places we wanted to visit were ever so friendly and helpful. We stayed in room 706 which was fantastic, large and bright, incredibly comfy bed and brilliant large flat screen tv with a huge choice of channels. The staff serving breakfast were also great, clearing a table for us as we got our juice and fruit. Breakfast itself was delicious, plenty of juice, fresh fruit, a very tasty white chocolate granola, plenty of coffee,bagels, breads, croissants and if that wasn't enough pancakes, eggs and ham. I 'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel, the owners should be very proud of their staff and cleaners for making our stay such a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy_Jones
Reviews.Content: The style of this hotel may not be for everyone but if you like modern, funky hotels then this is the place for you. We have stayed in many of them - some work and some just don't - by which I mean that at first glance the room looks lovely but you soon find there is a major practical problem like not being able to see to put make up on! The room here just worked, it had been well thought out, was very spacious, quiet and had everything we needed. Breakfast was fine although we found that things were not replenished very quickly at the buffet. Also there was not much in the way of cooked options (although this didn't bother us). The hotel is reasonably small - it is boutique after all - and so didn't have much in the way of public areas, but again, this did not bother us too much. They had a computer terminal with a printer which was useful for boarding passes and so on. The location is great - a reasonable walk to the old town and very near the shops! All in all, a good experience, and I would stay again if I returned to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Boutique Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: TO_Trips
Reviews.Content: Recommended by someone my wife met in Quebec City last year. Wow! Fabulous! Completely renovated with terrific contemporary decor. Large rooms. Good workspace in the room. Big flatscreen TV. Robes. High end toiletries. Terrific service from valet parking to front desk through to housekeeping. Not the cheapest accomodation in Montreal but central location ... we'll definitely stay there next time we go to Montreal! Couple of blocks from the bar scene on Rue Crescent, right off Sherbrooke. Rooms are exactly as shown on the website. Room price includes full breakfast in the high end resto inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: mvasu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend and had a lovely experience. It's a great hotel, very boutique. The best thing about it was the service. Fantastic nothing less. From the bellboys to the concierge all they do is ensure your stay is perfect. We needed a rental car and mentioned it to them at which point they did the research for us, providing all the options and letting us pick. Despite some reviews the breakfast was yummy. Fair variety warm or cold, and good coffee. We enjoyed the room, cute, relaxing and highly comfortable bed. You did not want to leave. Loved the bathroom concept with the blinds and open shower concept, very shick... So in reference to an earlier review I read, if you want wallpaper and old school wooden doors in your hotel, i suggest MOtel 8 those consumers. The gym was in construction, but they do have an offer to use a gym near by if wanted. Seemed like the lower floors were experiencing a makeover so there was some dust around, and because the room have deep dark wood there were some "dust" visible. If you know much about dust and dark wood, it's not that the room is not cleaned, but rather that EVERYTHING shows no matter how good the cleaning staff is. SO just a heads up if you do notice that. PS: the audi shuttle available is a fabulous plus, so thank you to the staff for a wonderful two nights!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Nice Room - Horrid Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Gigit77
Reviews.Content: We booked for our anniversary 2 nights. Overall, let me explain, my rating is low due to some problems, but there were some nice highlights as well. Our room was a "Gourmet" package including a deluxe King Size room with bathtub and 7 course meal. We seriously regret the gourmet package, which was a total disaster. Ok, first room they provided us with was a mistake, we were supposed to get a bathtub and reserved one long long in advance, instead we walk in and got a shower. the shower was silly, no door and in the winter, it was cold. Mind you, this hotel is known for their bathrooms and having a bathtub for our anniversary was a must. They had no other bathtubs available until the next day. The room was a bit dirty as in stuff splashed on the walls and the glass wall separating the bathroom from main room was covered in dust, everything else was pretty clean such as floor and shower, sheets were nice but terribly stiff so rough on the skin, lots of water on the windows (condensation) with water pooling in the window sills and dripping down the window making the room VERY humid and muggy. Very modern trendy decor, very large room. When they moved us to the other room, it was to our surprise the bi-level apartment suite. Very nice room, but again cleanliness needed improvement. Parts of the floor were dirty, stuff sprayed on walls in bathrooms which kind of grossed me out. However, we did appreciate the massive upgrade in the room and fantastic service. The staff there is excellent. The bathroom had an amazing set up, unfortunately we couldn't figure out how to drain the water in the tub and were only able to take a single bath. The restaurant. Oh boy. That place is a train wreck. First day breakfast (we dined in the restaurant) food was cold, tables were dirty with food all over, staff was rude. We had purchased a gourmet package with a 7 course meal in the evening which was a high light of our trip,, but we were not told it was a forced menu with raw seafood. After some huffle, they finally agreed to substitute the seafood for something else as I am allergic, but only for me not my husband. The seating was this very tiny table shoved in a very busy walkway near the stairs. Everything was eccentric, smelly and raw. Raw Emu, raw wild fish eggs, thymus glands, sea cucumbers, raw fish, and some sort of larvae where things wiggled when I brushed my fork over it. Interesting food is fine, we like our steak rare and enjoy calamari, but this was bird bites and just strange, what was worse is we had no choice in being served this stuff, it was forced on us and it was what we got regardless if we liked it or not. Staff that evening was OK. This cost us an additional $200, and it wasn't worth 5 bucks. We were so upset after that we went back to our room and went to bed. Food next day (breakfast) we had brought to our room. It was very cold, egg was raw and very runny, we were provided with a single packet of nutra sweet to split between both of our coffees, and it tasted gross. If you want to stay at the hotel, I would suggest avoiding the food like the plague. The hotel itself was excellent, very classy, great staff, but the food portion really brings the rating down by a VERY wide margin.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant boutique, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: grfiv
Reviews.Content: The front desk and bellman were very helpful upon arrival. The service that evening at the restaurant was excellent; the food was just so-so. Buffet breakfast was a nice touch. The rooms, while small, were tastefully decorated and well designed. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Queenston
Reviews.Content: I have never before written a review of a hotel in Canada when I am just there for a meeting--because so many of these hotels are such that one wants to forget them immediately. Not this time! I am very grateful to the member of our group who recommended this hotel--in fact, all of our group members were raving about how wonderful the hotel was by the end of our meeting! The rooms are lovely, and the glass partition between shower and bedroom gives a wonderfully spacious feeling. The service was impeccable at the front desk and elsewhere. The beds were as comfortable as in the best hotels where I have ever stayed. But la piece de resistance was the food--WOW!! I had an heirloom tomato platter as an appetizer that took my palate back to a Michelin starred restaurant in Stockholm (Bon Lloc). The scallop plate was also delicious. Even the sandwiches we had in the meeting were beautifully presented on individual platters with imaginative garnishes. The wines by the glass were thoughtfully selected--I had a crisp, perfectly chilled Viognier. Although the breakfasts were not as elegant (as to be expected), the food available was all of high quality. I can hardly wait for our next meeting which will be at the Toronto Le Germain!

Reviews.Title: “Spaciuos Room, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: AndreasMcKenzie
Reviews.Content: Hotel le Germain is a great place to stay in montreal . The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are chic and quite spacious. It's close to shopping, like Holt Renfrew and Ogilvy. It's only a ten minute walk from le Musee Beaux-Arts. The bed was comfortable and the linens were nice. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast wasn't very good but it was included in the room price, so it didn't matter that much. Overall, Le Germain is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon9
Reviews.Content: We arrived to Montreal on the weekend of Nascar and a gay parade (or so we were told) and a big majority of hotels were fully booked. We were desperate to find just a place to sleep, but this hotel was much better that just that. Location is great, not far from the train station (we arrived by train). The staff were friendly, check-in was fast. Room was clean with really cool furnishing. The bathroom had a really nice surprise: the shower had a glass through which you could see bedroom! Of course it was possible to use shades and disable this "feature". There was also a good breakfast with surprisingly wide choice (it was described as continental, so we didn't expect much) that was restocked often. The only funny thing at this hotel was the air conditioning system - we received special instructions for setting the room temperature on a little card when we checked in. It wasn't hard to use, just - different. Although we found this hotel by accident and didn't expect much, it was one of the best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: htravelbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Germain for three nights. Having difficulty locating a hotel room, as the NASCAR races were on, I opted for Le Germain when I confirmed they had availability, as we had stayed there before and were happy with the service and quality of the property. We arrived in Montreal by train and the Hotel is very conveniently located near the train station (5 min. walk) on Mansfield. The property is very well cared for and maintained and our room (502) was clean, comfortable and elegant, with a lovely view down la rue President Kennedy. The breakfast is delicious and a great way to start the day and while there was WIFI access in the room, we used the public computer in the lobby. A very nice touch is the coffee machine in the lobby where you can get a latte, americano, espresso, etc. on the house. We ate one evening in the hotel restaurant, Laurie Raphael and we had an absolutely wonderful meal. The quality of the food was superb and the service friendly and attentive, without any attitude. I would certainly eat there again, as it was excellent and good value, given the high calibre of the menu. Annik, the Concierge, was very friendly and professional, providing an excellent referral for dinner one evening. All in all, a wonderful place to stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with Very Friendly & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: PickyB
Reviews.Content: Le Germain is a lovely boutique hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful from the doormen to the receptionists to even the girl who answers their 1800 number when I'd check up on the reservation. The rooms are nicely decorated and spacious. We had one room with a king size bed that faced the back of the building and a room with a queen size bed that faced the front. I'd try to get something that faces the front as the back just looks at office buildings. The bathrooms were nice and spacious as well with modern appliances. We had one problem where the toilet didn't flush but they sent someone up immediately to fix it. I love the Aveda products that they give you as well. Breakfast was included and was very tasty. One complaint from my mother is that the coffeemachine didn't make the hottest coffee though. Hotel is in a great area near St. Catherine St and was a couple blocks from the Jazz Festival. Also, the concierge was so helpful in making dinner reservations for us and suggested some delicious restaurants such as le Clube Chasse et Peche and the lively Rosalie. I definitely recommend Le Germain!

Reviews.Title: “Le Germain Was A Great Pick!”
Reviews.Author: nyc156
Reviews.Content: There were many hotel options in Quebec and we certainly feel we made the right one! Le Germain was very modern and had a boutique hotel feel. While we were there was work being done in the restaurant but they still had a very substantial continental breakfast everyday. The concierge was also very helpful and recommended Europa Restaurant which was delicious. I would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: I agree somewhat with the previous review. I stayed at Le Germain in Toronto and felt that experience to be better and more professional even though the Toronto one didn't have a view from the breakfast area. I was surprised by the following things: -either no hot water, or cold water with calcified bits at the bottom, where the hot water for tea was supposed to come from; this happend all throughout my 2-night stay. Germain advertises as having 24-hr. tea/coffee service. I went down for a post dinner tea and there was nothing set up, and, the capuccino maker was broken at the time (granted, hotel staff were advised of this and tried to fix the problem immediately and someone came out from a back kitchen with a carafe of very hot water) -breakfast time was busy and food ran out fast, which is understandable, but it seemed to take forever for the staff to get it together and re-stock. In general, Le Germain remains to be a unique and luxurious hotel I would go back to, however, the one in Montreal seems to be getting "tired" and needs a boost of energy. For the price, I may have prefered to stay at the Ritz Carlton. However, one cannot complain about its location, front desk staff, QUIET rooms, and room comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Boutique - but”
Reviews.Author: kvd2101
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is nice and in a pretty good location, I give it a 3 overall. First, the pros: nice modern decor - minimalistic without feeling cold. The rooms, while small, were pretty well appointed, and the bathrooms were nice too. Some might think the see-through shower is gimmicky, but we thought it was cool. And the location was good - in downtown, just a few blocks away from the nicest area of town with good shopping and restaurants. While everything was OK, I can't say it was great. I don't have any service horror stories, but it was overall underwhelming. Here are a few examples: - We emailed the concierge in advance for specific restaurant recommendations. They emailed me back with a standard list (which is on their web site) instead of having anything specific - At breakfast (which was free with the room), someone came over to me and said "Some people are asking about what your room number is". I don't know if this was a language issue, but it sounded as if they thought I walked in off the street. - The maid's cart sat in the hallway outside our room for most of a day. Can't they get their work done - They only provide 2 towels, so when we were leaving to go out for dinner, we requested that they turn the room and replenish the mini-bar. Despite our request, they did neither. - The workout room is pretty pathetic...we paid 20 bucks to use the MAA sports club a few blocks away - After the 1st day, they never replenished those green apples that they make such a big deal about in the hallway on our floor. One other note - I didn't like the city of Montreal at all. Very seedy and industrial looking, blocks either felt touristy or desolate. Many people had told me it has a "European" feel - I am guessing these people had never been to Europe and are just impressed by French accents. You're better off spending a weekend in Boston or Philly. If you have to go to Montreal, though, I would suggest staying at the Loews Vogue if you want something more modern, or the Ritz Carlton if you want something more elegant and classic. They both seem a bit nicer with a slightly better location and have free access to the MAA sports club.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: QC_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Le Germain in Montreal as part of a "mini honeymoon". The rooms are stylish and welcoming, soft classical music is playing when you enter. It has a very modern feel. The beds are to die for, we didn't want to ever wake up and get on with our day. The buffet breakfast is decent as far as buffets go. Service from all staff we encountered was exceptional. They were very helpful in recommendations of places to eat and recommended a great sushi place just around the corner from the hotel. We can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: WharfTrader
Reviews.Content: stayed there a few weeks back for one night - very nice hotel - very clean - both the rooms we had were excellent - good size bedroom - big seperate bathroom - everything worked - staff were fine - great location for everything - maybe a little far to walk to Blvd St Laurent, but doable - would recommend crescent street for a good time, especially Newtown - nice and relaxed - only thing i would strongly recommend though is go with your partner - when you see the shower you'll understand why!

Reviews.Title: “So nice”
Reviews.Author: taylor5802
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two lovely nights at this hotel. I'm typically not the type to like modern style hotels. I like the â€œcushinessâ€� that comes with more opulent hotels so I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect at Le Germain. It was modern and cool and hip and simple and very very well done. It was clean and posh. The breakfast was just okay; itâ€™s included in the cost of the room so no big complaints. The service was great. I loved that they were generous with the bottled water in the room and by the door. The location was perfect for walking to so many different places.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perrrrrrrfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel with a lot of charm. Service impeccable and personnel extremely courteous. Would highly recommand. If you want to enjoy Montreal and feel like a king (queen) try Le Germain. Had diner at the Hyper Bistro Le G (which is the hotel's restaurant) and lllllllllllllllloved it, your should taste the scallop they where out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “An hotel with an heart!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have travelled the world to the finest hotels but I have to say that Le Germain as something very particular. From our first step at the door to the last one, all the staff were there to make our stay the most memorable experience. We loved our rooms so much that my wife and I bough the matrice and the bed sheets!!! What a good idea to recreate the Hotel Germain confort in our home! I are looking forward to discover their new property in Toronto! Hotel Germain - A Hotel with a heart!

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY disappointing”
Reviews.Author: xsollyx
Reviews.Content: I am growing weary of boutique hotels that self-create from converting a bad hotel or apartment building. This hotel compares very unfavorably against not only Montreal's top hotels, but even against three-star hotels. First, construction on the facade of the building meant that my room sounded as if the drilling were right in the hallway...all day. Not a good enviroment to get some work done. Of course, even though I reserved only a few days before arrival, no warning at all. Again, as one who travels half the year, I am tiring of hotels who lie or withhold information. The rooms are teeny. While the furnishings are fine, the room itslef is dumpy. Really, it reminds me of a dorm room in college if you would just bring in really nice furniture. The bathroom is fair at best. My room did not have a rainfall shower, just a glass shower with a fairly normal shower head. The exercise room is a joke. It's a converted single room with some old equipment thrown in. After this impression, you can understand why I didn't further roll the dice and eat at the hotel. Location is great but, so what, there are tons of hotels just as well-situated downtown.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious & just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: LesleyToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Germain was gorgeous, and the staff treated my partner and me like royalty. The room was HUGE with an enormous luxury bathroom and a big soaking tub. No view - we faced a wall. But the view was definitely indoors. I've never stayed in a nicer room anywhere. The restaurant was generally average. I don't like buffet breakfasts generally, and especially not in a luxury hotel. Dinner in the restaurant was presented very stylishly and the atmosphere was elegant. The taste of the food was average to above average - an attempt at haute cuisine. Overall, I'd highly recommend the hotel to anyone - business travellers or couples. LGBT friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Le Germain did everything right!”
Reviews.Author: ScarlettO1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a quick get- away from NYC and flew to Montreal for 4 days. We stayed at the Le Germain, based on reviews I had read on various forums. We were not disappointed in any way. The front desk was professional and quick to handle any questions. Our room was beautiful, overlooking the front of the hotel, with a very comfortable bed. I slept like a baby every night. I enjoyed fresh croissants and excellent coffee every morning. A great part of our enjoyment of Montreal was staying in such a nice hotel, I look forward to our next trip, in the summer.
